## Course Description

This is an introduction to the R statistical programming language, focusing on
essential skills needs to perform data analysis, from entry, to preparation, analysis,
and finally presentation.  

During the minicourse, you will not only learn basic
R functionality, but also how to leverage the exensive community-driven package 
ecosystem, and finally how to write your own functions in R.

<br>

## Course Content

### Module 1:  Introduction to Base R Environment

This model introduces the R programming language and the RStudio software.  R 
programming content will include coverage of basic operations
and data object types, including vectors, matrices, and data frames.

### Module 2:  Data Manipulation Using the Tidyverse

This module introductes a series of tools for data manipulation/preparation 
collectively known as the "Tidyverse."  Coverage is select data, arrange it,
transform it, and aggregate it.  Participants were also learn convenient tools to
import and export data.
